Reviews.Content: there for annual 3 day business meeting that is held around san diego area. hotel was easy to find, lots of parking, lots of friendly staff. even though i didn't have the breakfast chits they were willing to feed me no charge. we are hyatt gold pass members and they upgraded our room to an allergy free environment - ionizer, non-smoking, natural fibers, etc., overlooking the pool. food was excellent - we ate breakfast, lunch and a dinner there. didn't use sports area, but saw others - very clean and spacious. can't say enough about the very helpful and friendly staff - especially melanie, who checked us in and another melanie in the breakfast area working as maitre'd.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeuterMedia
Reviews.Content: We stayed over New Years to visit friends in La Jolla. Low AAA weekend rates include breakfast buffet - but the breakfast area in the lower section of the hotel is freezing cold! Rest is excellent, a couple good restaurants are just 50 feet from the hotel entrance. Small shopping mall in walking distance (just over the freeway). The hotel has a gym, but you have to leave the hotel and enter next door... Also interesting there is a sportsclub adjacent to the hotel (day use $13 for hyatt guests) - drawback - the sportsclub is using the hotel pool too. During warm days the pool will be crowded! As all the big hotels the fee for overnight parking is very high! There is very limited street parking. MeuterMedia

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.... Great Service..... Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Geigerdd
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 6 nights with my family and children in early January 2011. Overall, I love this hotel. It is a great value! The hotel is 4-star and only costs $116/night for an extra large room with a king bed & 4 person table. The package also included a second adjoining room for the kids with 2 queens for only $54/night and a fabulous free breakfast buffet worthy of a top-notch restaurant with ~8 hot breakfast entrees, juices, made to order omlets, etc. However, what I liked best about the hotel though was the service. In short it was outstanding from the reservation agent, front desk, restaurant servers, bellman, and parking garage staff. They made us feel at home and were very responsive and friendly to all our families requests. Historically, I have not been a huge fan of Hyatts.... but after staying at the Hyatt Regency LaJolla, I am definitely now a huge fan of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in an Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ka7890
Reviews.Content: I paid $85 plus taxes per night on Priceline for a four night stay in late December. The hotel is clean, has excellent service, a nice pool area, and a good bar in the lobby area. As a Priceline customer, everything other than the room was an extra charge: parking-$20 per day, internet access-$12 per day, gym use-$12 per day, no free coffee in the room- overpriced Starbucks in the lobby store, no free newspaper, etc. As a result, I parked on the street, went to the coffee shop about a mile away for free internet, and swam laps in the pool for exercise. The location is inconvenient if you want to walk to go anywhere. There's really nothing except for an expensive steakhouse across the courtyard and then there are several office buildings. This location doesn't seem to be the best place for a luxury hotel. It is convenient enough though if you have a car and don't mind driving as it is just off I-5 and a few minutes from I-805.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Diogenesway
Reviews.Content: We travel one week each month! The way we do it is to use 4-Star Priceline Hotels only. The room price averages 70% off their normal posted rate! This hotel was exceptional in it quality and location. The many employees we talked to included our floor maid Ludmillia who was a most caring and helpful maid we have seen in years! The Hostess in the dining room (Melenie) and the food-service manager (Mitch Mason) were both pleasant and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service--if you come, bring your own towels!”
Reviews.Author: Grzthewash
Reviews.Content: For those who might think service is not all that important at a hotel--picture yourself with your family in a jacuzzi in the freezing cold realizing that there is not a single towel at the pool. You call the front desk on your cell phone requesting towels but 45 minutes later--you guesse it--still no towels. You and your family walk back to the room soaking wet and freezing, your wet five-year-old slips and falls, hurting his back, and you finally make it back to your room. You call the front desk to inquire into this situation, and you are put on hold for ten minutes. You finally talk to the "manager" who explains that the towels periodically run out and that there were a lot of swimmers that day (notwithstanding the fact that it was pouring rain most of the day). I am not sure what is going on at this hotel but it really seems like amateur hour in terms of the management. The bottom line--if you come, bring your own towels!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed for a great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: allenandstef
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at the Hyatt Regency La Jolla â€“ and it continued to meet our needs wonderfully. Itâ€™s a few miles north of downtown San Diego, just off of I-5. Very convenient access to the freeway and everything in the region. Close to the airport and a short drive away from downtown San Diego. Though it has â€œLa Jollaâ€� in its name, youâ€™re not within easy walking distance to the village of La Jolla. It is, however, a very short drive away. You are close to lots of shopping and dining. We love the location. Some others have complained about the location being too far from La Jolla Village or from downtown San Diego. But we like the convenience to all of that. This is Southern California â€“ no matter where you stay, youâ€™ll need a rental car to get around. And this location provides quick and easy access to all of the sites in the city, Balboa Park, Coronado, the north county area, etc. Typical of most Hyatts, Hiltons, Marriotts, etc., they do charge for parking, Internet use, etc. Iâ€™m not crazy about that, but thatâ€™s just how it is. It seems to be primarily a business hotel, so it makes sense that they will try to make money off of people with expense accounts. So be it. If youâ€™re looking for free parking, free Internet and free breakfast, then keep driving until you find a Holiday Inn Express. We arrived very early in the day after an early morning flight. Not expecting our room to be ready, we went to drop off our luggage. To our surprise, our room was ready. Each of the staff people we encountered â€“ valet, door man, front desk, guest services, etc. â€“ was most helpful. They called us by name as often as they could and always greeted us warmly and welcomed us back each time we walked through the front door. They were always professional and courteous and offered directions, restaurant recommendations and more. I appreciate that kind of service! If youâ€™re going to the zoo or other attractions, check at the front desk to see if you can purchase tickets there. We were able to get our zoo tickets at the hotel and didnâ€™t have to stand in line once we got to the zoo. The pool area is very nice! Outdoors (obviously), itâ€™s a great way to take advantage of the Southern California sun. The pool is large, with a very large hot tub, fountains, etc. Itâ€™s surrounded by chaise lounge chairs, dining tables, sofas, and cabanas. It can accommodate a LOT of people before it begins to feel crowded. It was always quiet at night â€“ great time for an evening swim or soak after a fun day of sightseeing. The health club requires a fee â€“ itâ€™s in a separate building near the pool, and part of an adjacent office complex. Kind of a bummer if youâ€™re looking to work out every day. I didnâ€™t use it, but it appears to be very nice and offers spa services. If youâ€™re just interested in cardio, then ask about nearby trails or jogging routes. Itâ€™s a very nice area and appears to be totally safe, day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, Ok, Rooms aren't very clean, super staff otherwise”
Reviews.Author: judbean
Reviews.Content: The grounds are nice. The meeting space is ok. Giant stains on the carpet. The staff is very accomodating. No coffee makers in the room-unheard of. Location is ok., $15 to downtown La Jolla in a cab. My room had dried liquid of various colors on the wallpaper, a gob of tooth paste on the bathroom door and the tub took an hour to drain. The maids did not clean my tub. When I went to take my second shower all my hair was still in the tub. There were seeds on my carpet (maybe trail mix?). The nice flats screens are blurry, not a clear picture. Restaurant on site are very nice but very $$$. Plumbing is so loud, when others use it above you. No b usiness center - no practical for a business hotel. Nice pool. Fitness club is like $13/day.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Makes this Hotel One to Return To”
Reviews.Author: LegacyPlanner
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for several years, coming down once a quarter and staying for 3 - 4 nights each time. Every time I return it feels like home. Many of the staff have been there for years and you get the sense of a larger family atmosphere among the staff. You are warmly greeted by the front desk, the bellmen remember your name, the wait staff and housekeeping are attentive and polite. Marilyn, the concierge at the Club Level lounge makes your evenings special, and serves a filling evening assortment of cold and hot snacks and appetizers. The workout facilities are top notch, as is the pool. Food is outstanding, although room service fees are excessive. I noticed this last trip that they've removed the in room coffee makers (upon request now) and cheapened the towels for cost cutting measures, but it's still a lovely hotel, with several fantastic restaurants across the driveway, and a large mall complex within a 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, nice service”
Reviews.Author: MisspahVank
Reviews.Content: Well we actually stayed here because the Marriott in San Diego overbooked our reserved room so the bumbed us over to the Hyatt Regency for free. Though annoyed at being bumped to another hotel at 11pm at night after a 5 hour drive, the wonderful treatment I received from the Hyatt staff made it all better. The staff was very gracious, helpful and professional. The rooms were impeccably clean and odor free...just the way I like them. Plush, comfortable beds with modern decor. It was very quiet for a Friday evening and we slept just fine. The room had all the amenities of a 4 typical star hotel. The free continental breakfast buffet was nice. However, the room that they served it in was very small and overcrowded. By the time my daughter and I got to the buffet there was alot of trash and dirty plates laying all over the place from other guests. There was no attendant in there to help keep it tidy. I blame some of the lazy guests for not finding the trash can, but I think they would have been more conciencous if there was an attendant in the buffet room. Overall, I would definately stay there again. I liked it better than the original hotel in which I was booked.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service attitude...”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl6570
Reviews.Content: Amazing customer service attitude! Everyone you encounter is "out of their way" nice and helpful. Very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but everything else was lackluster”
Reviews.Author: rpstro02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency La Jolla in September for business. When checking in, the girl at the front desk was very courteous and seemed to genuinely care that I enjoy my stay. This was nice and my other run-ins with hotel staff were similarly pleasant. If I was ever running a company with large customer service organization, I would find out who the customer service trainer was here and hire them. Unfortunately, the Hyatt needed a lot of improvement in other areas. My room seemed 'dingy'. Black marks here and there on the walls and furniture don't seem like a big deal, but when added all together it just gives a dirty feeling. Furthermore, the ceiling and walls seemed very thin. I could hear the person above me moving around and I could hear phone calls the person was making in the room next to me. I could also hear cheers from the bar when the Chargers were playing. If you want to check out San Diego as a tourist, this probably isn't the place to be as it's very far from downtown. There is a large shopping center with several grocery stores and restaurants within walking distance which was nice, but not a lot of tourist attractions. Overall, I'd stay here again only if I was attending an event in the area and if I could get a cleaner room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for a leadership training class that was being held in the building next door. Overall, I thought this was a nice business hotel. The staff was exceptionally friendly and service oriented -- everyone from the front desk to the valet to the housekeeper was very pleasant and helpful. There was never a line at the front desk. Valets were very helpful with directions. The location is convenient -- it's right off the freeway. There are several excellent restaurants right across from the hotel in case you don't want room service (Flemings, Japengo, Melting Pot, etc). They have a deal with a full-service gym that is located on the property, so you have to pay an entrance fee to get in. The entrance fee was included with my training, but for others that could be annoying. The gym itself is excellent, with classes and large quantities of fitness equipment. There is a small coffee shop to the right of the lobby. The room is decent, your average business hotel. The first room they gave me had a bad odor, but when I asked to be switched, they moved me right away with no hassle. The soundproofing between rooms isn't great -- I could hear my next door neighbor coughing in his room. However, they do have complimentary earplugs at the front desk, which took care of the issue. Overall, I think this hotel is a fine business hotel -- I wouldn't mind coming back for business, but would definitely not recommend for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property- and good location near UCSD”
Reviews.Author: mosh
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at this property. It is well maintained, modern and staffed by friendly but professional employees, especially at the front desk. Rooms are spacious and quiet. Elevators seemed to be quick and efficient for a high-rise. We were there during an earthquake and felt the rolling effects of the stabilizers which were disconcerting but not frightening. We felt safe although we weren't sure what was happening. Called the front desk and they were calm and reassured us they were checking on things and called us back to confirm the event and ask if we needed anything. On the negative side; some of the valets were unpleasant and seemed to be focused on their tip. Parking charges are annoying and excessive, and they don't have their own fitness center. They offer access with a fee which is crazy- and also explains why we rated this hotel as Very Good instead of Excellent. We'd stay again if the rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: Pleco
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent - beautiful, rooms were very good, very clean, comfy beds, staff was attentive, really nice. Can't say anything bad! But I'd say this hotel might be geared more to business since we saw alot of business-types at breakfast. But that's not a bad thing! 5 min drive to La Jolla shores, 10-15 mins to downtown San Diego and Old Town. If you want to stay near La Jolla shores it will cost twice as much. Only thing I could say is if you want to stay within walking distance of restaurants/shops there is a Hyatt in downtown San Diego next to the Seaport shops. I did not stay there but it looked nice too! But overall, this hotel is a winner. And, I forgot to mention they have a gorgeous huge pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, $25/day parking and $10/day internet prevent it from being great.”
Reviews.Author: moorg
Reviews.Content: The Good Our check-in was quick and painless. The person at the front desk was cheerful and gave us a warm welcome. He also provided driving directions without prompting when he discovered the reason for our visit. The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous. The bar on the lobby level looks very nice though we did not eat or drink there. It has an outside patio with fire pits and HD televisions. The king-size bedroom is very clean and in great shape. The bed and linens are outstanding. Four lamps provide the light to the bedroom and one hall light lights the entry area. The bathroom is roomy. I appreciate the desk and the two additional chairs to sit in. I expect a room of this quality to contain a refrigerator but it does not. The TV and chest of drawers have a sharp appearance but the TVâ€™s performance is lacking (discussed below). The Bad A non-HD analog line feeds the LG HD TV. If you are used to HD content you know that standard format content looks terrible on a HD TV. Worse though is the menu system to control the TV. I am unable to change between ESPN and The Discovery Channel without making this navigation process: Menu -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Channel Guide -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Down -> Select. ESPN is channel 18 and The Discovery Channel is 19. No, you cannot enter the channel number with the remote control or use the Up/Down buttons. The Ugly Wireless Internet access became standard 10 years ago. The Hyatt Regency charges $10/day for wifi. No, there is no other access point that you can connect to. Luckily I was on vacation for the purpose of unplugging from the world. Had this been a business trip I would either have to pay the bounty for Internet access or select a hotel that does not insist on nickel-and-diming its customers. I read about parking on several travel websites but did not let it prevent me from booking this hotel. Valet parking is $8/hour or $25/night. Self-parking in the garage beneath the hotel is $3/hour or $20/night. My wife and I were able to cope with the parking situation but it was a major inconvenience. We elected to save our money by parking on the streets around the hotel. This was only possible because my wife and I are athletic and she was able to take our bags to our room while I parked the car when we arrived. If you are traveling by yourself or if long walks (including several flights of stairs or major inclines) tire you, I suggest planning on using the self-parking in the garage. My shortest walk from my car to the hotel lobby was 200 yards and including crossing 6 lanes of traffic and 3 flights of stairs. My longest was a quarter mile, though it was traffic and stairs free. There are other businesses and apartments in the area that each has patrons that park along the streets, making finding a spot near the front of the hotel difficult.

Reviews.Title: “what a great weekend in La Jolla!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlrb07
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency LaJolla for a long weekend to attend a wedding last week. Overall, it was a terrific stay! The one thing that stood out to me was the impeccable service! Vicky and Emily at the front desk were so friendly and willing to help with recommendations, directions, and neosporin! Waitstaff at the pool, valets and doormen were very friendly and constantly moving to meet the needs of their clientele. The hotel was very clean and we were on the Regency club level. To us, it was definitely worth the upgrade fee for the access to continental breakfast, snacks, and drinks throughout most of the day. The furnishing/decor of the room was a little dated but the room was so quiet and the bed very comfortable. The hotel has a beautiful pool area with a bar and cabanas. The pool is heated which is a bonus. The parking (valet or self park garage) is expensive but there are many places along the street nearby where we were able to park at no charge. The hotel is not in the La Jolla cove area; it is about a 10 minute drive, but the drive is pleasant. I checked that "yes" there is a Fitness Center but it is actually its own entity adjacent that incurs an additional fee for use. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “First choice full,their alternative-comparable”
Reviews.Author: wpaapw
Reviews.Content: I could not get a room at a conference I was attending, my fault last minute, the Estancia, referred me to the Hyatt and gave them an equal though different ambiance, I was pleased with the place and had a positive experience, I was AAA, and I took advantage of business upgrade at a 15$ dollar cost though with the triple A I got the same as I received with the 15 dollar upgrade, breakfast and a room with a view,breastfast free either way,!5.$ wasted but I'm sure if I complained they would refund? I made the choice,..... It had a great buffet breakfast, egg whites scrambled even, beautiful place for kids and solo or??????

Reviews.Title: “Honestly!”
Reviews.Author: ahryunbunch
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the layout of the hotel is not very user friendly. Being a first-time guest here, we drove up to the lobby doors as usual only to find there is only valet parking at outrageous rates. After being directed to the parking garage below where we can self-park, we had to figure out how to get to the lobby to check in. Nothing was obvious. Not to make it too confusing, this hotel has two lobbies; so which lobby is it that we need? We drove nearly three hours to get here and now I'm cranky having to deal with somebody's idea of creative hotel architecture. I'm finally in my hotel room. Really? It looks just like a Hampton Inn & Suites room without the price tag. The bathroom had no drawers in which to store my toiletries; the countertop was small so storing the toiletries there made everything too crowded. There is no vent system in the bathroom so showering created an even muggier environment than La Jolla already is. The pillows and bed were nice. I actually slept well which doesn't usually happen in a hotel. Even so, I'd rather stay somewhere else which costs less for the same or better.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt should do better . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: beeeeeebs
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt Regency is listed as a 4 star facility, more likely should be 3, at the very most The room is a generous size, but, there is no exhaust system in any of the bathrooms, and, the AC is just not adequate. There is no place to be outside except at the pool that is part of a health club. When requesting something from housekeeping the request had to be repeated several times. Too - aside from the dresser draws, there aren't any. For a pleasure trip to be at the shore in La Jolla its at least a ten to fifteen minute car ride. Very convenient to the freeway. Summing up, perhaps for a business trip this Hotel would be adequate, not great, for pleasure really not a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with my stay here”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in mid-June to attend a CCL conference at the building just behind the hotel. Upon check in the staff was friendly and efficient giving me a choice of room/view. My room was clean and nicely appointed albeit with some stained carpeting (no big deal). I ordered room service once and the proportions and quality were great. We had lunch at the hotel daily and it was one of the better hotel buffet's I've had. I didn't use the gym or pool at the hotel but the pool was beautiful to look at. The restaurants right on the property were a huge plus for travelers without transportation.

Reviews.Title: “WE WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN, HERE'S WHY.....”
Reviews.Author: stolstad
Reviews.Content: We just spent $1,126.63 on staying at this hotel. We booked it because of a medical conference I was attending. I read the reviews about the parking, and being an idiot, did not take them to heart. The parking in unbelievable. We could not find a parking spot on the street!! We spent expensive gas driving the 2 streets the hotel tells you about. We finally decided to park in the garage for $20 PER NIGHT. Valet parking is $25 per night, but you will have to tip! (they deserve it anyway) Upon entering the garage the sign attached to the wall said: THIS GARAGE CONTAINS CHEMICALS KNOWN TO THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA TO CAUSE CANCER, BIRTH DEFECTS OR OTHER REPRODUCTIVE HARM. (THIS WARNING REQUIRED BY SECTION 25249.6 OF THE CA, HEALTH & SAFETY CODE) My husband is in very delicate medical condition, in fact, we have a handicapped parking license, but in this case it helped us none. I was not going into that garage and causing my husband any more medical maladies. Wow!!! What do they have in this garage??? We went to the front desk and asked a very pretty young lady what this was about. She claimed she had no knowledge of this. She promised to get back to our room with the info, but she did not. How can she not know about this??? This garage is attached to their hotel!! So again, we spent the rest of the week wasting time trying to park a car and getting a lot of exercise walking back to the hotel. NEVER EVER would we ever stay here again, just for this one reason. We checked in with a "Paula Lanning." I had an option to upgrade for $29 per night, but she refused to allow it. Thank you Paula!! It would have been a waste of our money. It would not have given us a different room, I just like to have concierge access to get coffee and sodas. (No, this hotel, does not give complimentary liquor and we don't drink anyway, so we could care less about that.) So we saved over $180! My complimentary breakfast ticket went to my husband who needs to eat in the morning. No complimentary extra breakfast tickets at this hotel, like we have gotten at Radissons and Hiltons! Each one has my name on it and DATED, so I bet they don't allow you to use 2 the same day. Shame on the public for even trying this! How terrible that you would want to have breakfast one day together, huh? Then I guess if you don't use it the day it is dated for, you loose it?? Why so cheesy about a breakfast ticket??? Isn't this a little embarrassing for a Hyatt, to have someone sit down and write these out so specifically??? Come guys, have some class!! When you walk into this hotel and get up to your room, you get the feeling that this hotel is nice, but...............is very bare bones. I think they are cutting costs down to a very tight budget. No beautiful flower arrangements or complimentary apples, zippooooooo. The hotel seemed to be very dead to me, I asked one of the valets what the booking % was right now, and he said it wasn't very busy, so I don't understand why she refused to upgrade us, but it worked out the best for us anyway, and actually the hotel lost money. The room is very sparse, the furniture green, 60's-ish that had a few battle scares on them. We were suppose to have free internet in our room, but we do not carrry a laptop. My husband checked on the business floor and the internet would have been very expensive. The beds are fine, but what is up with some of these hotel linens?? Why when you open the bed at night, the whole bed falls apart and the bottom flat sheet is so small it can't even be tucked in?? Your whole bed is a mess during the night because nothing stays put. Can't we expect a better linen set up at a Hyatt???? The water in our bathroom sink trickled out, very annoying. They give you very minimal amount of towels. The air conditioning in our room broke. They had to send an engineer up to fix it. I have had 7 years of college!! I think I understand how a thermostat works!! But I had to listen to instructions anyway. If you set it for 72 degrees, then that the desired level, what a concept!!!!!!!!!! My husband was not very impressed with the buffet breakfast, the eggs were always cold, and the potatoes greasy. I was also not impressed with the lunch they gave us at the conference. This area is outstanding with excellent restaurants!!!! IF ONLY YOU COULD PARK YOUR CAR AT YOUR HOTEL the geographic position of this hotel is ideal. The room was clean, but sparse, and again the bed linens were a nightmare, but excellent bed. The people that are still with me here I wonder if this little tiny thing means something to you. The pens were the cheapest I have seen in my life. So you gotta know they are trying to cut corners in every way possible. I have thousands of pharmaceutical pens, so you get used to nice ones. Thank you for listening, no, not ever would I stay here again. If I am going to put money into a hotel, I want something back, and especially convenience in parking. You guys, listen, EXCELLENT HOTEL: THE RITZ-CARLTON IN MARINA DEL REY. We have to say that this hotel exceeds the standards of Mayfair London. The Ritz was the first hotel that my husband and I actually wanted to live at!!!!! Now we see why movie stars love hotel living. Please, stay at the Ritz, you will love it. What we noticed when we first walked in was an oustanding upglass hotel that didn't have that front desk imperious attitude. The room are outstanding, the staff friendly, etc etc. STAY THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in sunny San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Hyatt Regencys I've stayed at. The lobby is well appointed, the rooms are clean and modern and the service is excellent. Befitting the location, the hotel has a southwest feel--lots of terra cotta. The hotel is popular for meetings and conferences so you will see lots of people with name badges walking around. Parking is $20 self park and $25 valet per night. Of course there is a charge for internet though they waive it if you have a high Gold Passport status (Platinum I think). Connected to the hotel is a massive health club, for which they charge $13 ($11 for Gold Passport members). The health club also has a juice bar which serves excellent sandwiches. The hotel has no fitness center of its own. The hotel does have a nice heated pool which can be used for laps. I had an upgrade coupon for Regency Club and even though they didn't have any rooms available on that level I got access to the lounge. Frankly I was underwhelmed by the lounge. There is no view--there really aren't any windows. Just some tables, a small buffet, and a TV area. Happy hour had some cold appetizers, nuts, one hot appetizer, and some drinks. Beers seemed to be free during happy hour. There was a continental breakfast with salmon, bagels, cereal, etc. Not sure if it would be worth the extra cost to stay on that level unless you had a big family to feed for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMY, queit, just off the interstate”
Reviews.Author: jazz-key
Reviews.Content: Very roomy, nice staff, easy access off interstate, easy covered parking, HUGE room, Starbucks in hotel, pretty swimming area, quiet atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel except.........”
Reviews.Author: dlromero
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when we go to San Diego. The Hyatt is a beautiful and luxurious hotel. There are restaurants right across the way which is really nice if you don't want to drive anywhere. The pool area is also great and large. My only complaints about the hotel are their rooms with double beds which have full size beds but seem like they are single beds. Another thing is their parking which is expensive I believe about $15 + daily or you can valet. Your other option there is find parkling in the sorrounding area which is what we usually do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Business Hotel -- Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TransCon1
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this property on the way to San Diego on a weekend trip a number of years ago. It was very new then, and looked forward to staying there on business. A colleague located in San Diego selected the hotel for a series of presentations. I was with her when she looked as the space and met with the staff. I was impressed with the nice professional manner with which the meeting staff worked. We checked into the hotel after a long day which started in Seattle, stoped in Portland, and then made the big hop to SAN. The hotel has an elegant, upscale feel when you walk in -- especially at night. Both my collegue (from the east coast) and I commented on how much we wanted to go into the inviting bar with the music, etc., but were wiped out and faced a long day in the A,M. My co-worker even more so, since he was a portfolio manager from the east coast -- he was up at 3:00 AM working. The room was very spacious and comfortable as were the meeting roome. The service, food and physical space were all top notch. I was sorry I only was staying the one night, as it was on to L.A. the following day. So, I didn't get to use the pool or much of anything else. The hotel is right on the 5 freeway, but I didn't have any noise issues at all (my room didn't actually face the freeway, though. It was a great stay (just like my personal stay years earlier).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: otgmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice for business or travel. The staff was super attentive, friendly, and genuine in ensuring our visit was excellent. The local restaurants were excellent. The location was a perfect spot to hop in any direction - La Jolla, Del Mar, Mission Bay, Downtown. The best part was you feel is the atmosphere is one of luxury and true getaway. I will be a repeat customer. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: ChristaB3
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and the place was clean. I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay Every Time”
Reviews.Author: LocomotiveBreath
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel in San Diego. The front desk staff is very welcoming, cordial, friendly, and professional. The valets always take great care of my vehicle and they are always making sure that we are being taken care of. The rooms are comfortable and clean with good views from every direction. Room service is very attentive and the meals we ordered to the room were delicious, the best breakfast in bed. The Aventine fitness center, spa, and the pool are excellent. A great place to spend a weekend relaxing. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Better for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: CuatroPaisanas
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel... clean and plush. But there is an extra fee for EVERYTHING. And being a four star hotel, how is it there is no mini-fridge in the room? The staff was very courteous and helpful. The fitness center is amazing, but you must pay to use it. The hotel is not in the village of La Jolla, but it's not a far drive to get there. A car is a definite to get about town but parking costs $20 a day. There is street parking available. They definitely cater to business travelers. We enjoyed our stay, but I would prefer to stay at a more tourist friendly establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: motonic
Reviews.Content: Hyatt during Christmas is perfect choice, decorations, friendly and helpful staff ensure a good hotel base. Michaels is very nice after dinner spot. Hot chocolate/cookies was a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Labour Day Visit”
Reviews.Author: WayneG99
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in the Hotel, visitung Sea World and several places in La Jolla

Reviews.Title: “best hotel bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: vwterry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location just off interstate 5. No, it's not near the water, but you pay (much less!) accordingly. Very nice hotel--attractive and clean. I was on the 6th floor and went to bed pretty early (came from the east coast), and had no problem with noise on a Saturday night. Most hotel beds are much too soft for me, but these were firm without being hard. I had the best night's sleep in a hotel that I've had in a long, long time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Valet parking, though not cheap ($25), was very convenient. (Because I was traveling alone, I sought out a hotel that offers valet parking.) I would have given the hotel a higher rating, but the water pressure in the shower was barely acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for La Jolla business trips”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times in the past year for business trips in the areas north of San Diego. It's a solid business hotel, with good rooms, easy access to the freeway and good service. I've never encountered a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, gracious staff, always greeted by name”
Reviews.Author: skiaddict30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a trip to La Jolla and absolutely loved the stay. I have never experienced hotel staff so gracious, that always greeted us by name and were constantly trying to make us feel at home. The hotel is gorgeous. Great restaurants nearby and the hotel bar has a wonderful atmosphere. We are dying to go back. Gorgeous swimming pool - it's huge. I swam laps in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AlexMarinaDelRey
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I enjoyed this hotel during our weekend stay in La Jolla. We both noticed how good the floors smelled each time we exited the elevator. And we really enjoyed the 16th floor lounge if you are lucky enough to have access to it. Only negatives to the hotel are it's not very soundproof, they charge for parking, and internet access. I believe the internet is free in the lounge, and you if you can find street parking, you will save yourself some $$.

Reviews.Title: “Great quick escape”
Reviews.Author: mjk8371
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, Saturday Sept. 12, 2009. We got a good rate on Priceline a week or so ahead of time. Called the hotel around 1:00 pm to ask what time check-in was, and they said to come now and they'd let us check in early. Arrived around 3:00 and the front desk clerk was very friendly, gave us our choice of high-level or low-level room, we opted for the high and got a 14th-floor "city lights" view (looking inland) room. We parked on the street and the desk clerk gave us no grief for avoiding the parking fee. The staff was all very accommodating and friendly. They even granted our request for a late (2:00 pm) check-out time on Sunday. The room was great. Very comfortable bed with great bedding that feels like there's silk woven into the sheets. We enjoyed the poolside cabanas both Saturday and Sunday, which were readily available at no additional cost. The only hiccup, service-wise, during our entire stay was the fact there were no towels available at the pool on Sunday. We thought that was sort of odd. On Saturday there were tons of them. Overall, the hotel provided a great mini vacation; it was very comfortable and relaxing. For dinner on Saturday night we chose to eat at the Fleming's right across from the hotel entrance, so we didn't have to get back in the car the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for leisure”
Reviews.Author: Seneschal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is remote and far from both downtown La Jolla and the beach. We got a deal on Priceline for $85 so we stayed here. As others reviewers have pointed out, the self-parking price is pretty outrageous for such a remote location. However, the good news is you can park on the street pretty safely, on the main drive facing the hotel, if you are willing to take a 5-10 minute walk. Beware, though, the hotel will automatically tack on the parking charges, I had to dispute it before they remove it (three nights parking, adds up!). We've stayed here a couple times before due to the relatively cheap pricing through Priceline. One thing is consistent though, the maintenance crew doesn't know what they're doing! Our toilet wasn't flushing correctly so I called down to front desk. Sure enough, by the time I came back there was a note of apology with two pieces of chocolate on the sink. That's great, except the toilet still does NOT flush! The time before was in a different room on a different floor with a bathtub that wasn't draining. Since we checked out the next day we just had to keep re-flushing. There is a swimming pool but it's a fairly long walk to the hotel. There are two on-site restaurants but for alternatives it's a 5-10 minute drive down the road. Overall, I would characterize this as a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once Was Enough”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGranny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is FAR from the beach even though it is listed as "coastal". It is definitely not a place to stay with children. No regridgerator, no microwave, etc. The room was a typical Hyatt and was clean, but again it is not a "family friendly" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but, not amazing”
Reviews.Author: JackBrad
Reviews.Content: This is a nice business hotel, if going for pleasure I woudl stay somewhere else. The bar wasexcellent. The room was nicely decorated (Standard hyatt). Staff was very friendly and well prepared.

Reviews.Title: “First impression...I'm not impressed and I haven't even stayed there yet”
Reviews.Author: howardfriend
Reviews.Content: I just called to inquire about certain types of units such as a two bedroom unit or connecting units and it seems the person on the other end didn't quite understand what was being asked. I don't believe the question was too complicated, do you have two bedroom units? Perhaps she was thinking two beds in a unit? Then I inquired about connecting units-silence at the other end, I could almost hear her thinking. So I clarified w/an example of two standard units that can be connected, can't guarantee that. I don't understand why the certain type of accommodation cannot be held if one is holding it w/a credit card-that really boggles my mind but then again, I'm not in that business. Anyway, I'm not impressed if people working in the reservations dept cannot decipher inquiries on type of units their hotel can accommodate when that is their job. It reflects on their hiring practice and it makes me wary of the rest of the staff and their performance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liltravelbuddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice although the location was a little remote from the heart of La Jolla. The rooms were very nice, the pool was heated, and the work out facilities were amazing (there is a fee). Like most high end hotels there is a fee for the fitness area, parking, and internet. Luckily, they do have a computer to print out boarding passes. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: Frugal_traveler21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Jolla Hyatt Regency from June 28 through July 1, 2009. The stay was disappointing from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. When we arrived at 4:30 p.m., our rooms were not ready. They were supposed to be ready at 3:00 p.m. The front desk didn't know when they would be ready and told us to go sit buy the pool and buy $8 drinks. The pool area is very nice with a large pool with lanes and a whirlpool. When we arrived at the pool, there were no places to sit. Finally a table opened up and we sat down. After an hour, I went back to the front desk and inquired about the rooms. They were still not ready and the front desk still had no idea when they would be ready. It is now 5:30 p.m. Front desk told us we could use the Regency Club during our stay due to the delay. I thought this was a nice gesture. We went up to the Regency Club and started to get drinks and food, when the front desk saying they would be right up with our keys. So we only got a quick soda thinking the keys would be right up. A half an hour later, the keys finally arrived. When we got to the rooms, the refrigerators had not arrived, so then we had to wait for the refrigerators until we could leave. The rooms did not face the pool as promised, which was to the west so we could watch the sunsets. The Regency Club wasn't available after the first visit, different from we were told. Finally, the refrigerators arrived and we left. The next problem was that we could not get on the internet in our room. Its bad enough that the Hyatt charges $9.95 per night, per room for internet service, but we were not able to get on. We called the front desk and were told that an engineer would come up to get us connected, but they never showed up that first night. We called again the next morning and were told an engineer would be up, but they never showed up again. We were finally able to talk to an engineer, but they were unable to get us connected. So I would not count on internet connectivity in this hotel. And it is very troubling that the front desk told me twice that someone would come to the room to connect us to the internet, and no one ever came. Another thing to be aware of is that in the King room there is no desk. So if you plan to work, you should get a room with two queen beds, which includes a desk. Also, there are virtually no available electrical outlets in the rooms other than those needed for the television. Also, there is no phone book in the room. Another situation to be aware of is that you must be 18 years old to enter the work out facility. We were traveling with two 16 year olds who needed to work out related to extra curricular activities, and were stopped at the door by an attendant and told they could not enter because they were not 18 years old. They asked if they could come in if a parent was with them and were told "no". Next, I would recommend avoiding a room at the end of a hallway. In my room there could be heard a loud banging noise on an intermittent basis during both the second and third nights of our stay. I reported this to the front desk and they told me they would look into it, but I never heard back from them and the noise continued right up until we left on Wednesday morning. At checkout, they told me they checked but that there was no noise, which only added to my growing frustration after two sleepless nights in their 4 star hotel. Also at checkout, they had charges from one of their restaurants on my bill which I never stepped foot in, so I had to go through the process of having that removed from my bill. Another situation to be aware of is that if you happen to use Hyatt points for your stay, at this Hyatt that does not cover valet parking. When I have used Hyatt points in the past, I have never had to pay for parking. The valet parking was $25.00 per night. Self parking was $20.00 per night. Finally, when we were leaving, we carried all of the luggage out to where we load the car. I received a call while waiting on the car, so when the car arrived the doorman just started cramming all of the luggage into the trunk. When I saw him doing this I told him to stop, but he just kept right on cramming. By the time I could get off the phone he had the trunk full with about 2/3 of our luggage. I came and told him to stop - again - that we had more to go in the trunk and you couldn't just throw all the luggage in their in some haphazard fashion. In the process of his cramming stuff in, a Christmas ornament was broken (which we found out after we arrived home). So then I had to pull the luggage out of the trunk and repack it. This is the most dismal stay I have had at a Hyatt. We were very disappointed. I tried to limit my comments to keep the length manageable. I would not stay at this Hyatt again even for free. It is not conveniently located, not even to La Jolla. This hotel is at least 3 miles from La Jolla. It is not close to a beach. It does have any good views. It does have a Melting Pot, Flemings, and Japengo's (sushi) right next door that you can walk to, but if you don't want to spend $50 to $100 per person for a meal, you have to drive somewhere. I stay in Hyatt hotels elsewhere on a regular basis, but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: drsulfur
Reviews.Content: Emily the ront desk receptionist went over and behind her duties by surprising us with champion and desert for my son who was getting married the next day. Spacius room, easy access from freeway, in/out parking privliges. close to beach, resturants on site and within walking distance. will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Cool place - but watch out for costs of paying for parking @ this place !!”
Reviews.Author: teisho71
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - clean, as expected. Stay here .. but have extra cash for the parking ... and also to use a computer here is outrageously overpriced !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option, Especially at Prices mentioned by others....”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is well located in my opinion, as it is right off the freeway and close enough to La Jolla village without being in the crowds. Given that most of the hotels in the village are more expensive and somewhat run down, this is a good, peaceful option. The Hotel is nice with an elegant lobby, clean rooms (bathrooms could use an update) and pleasant staff. Excellent pool and athletic facilities and the hotel looks to be an ideal choice for holding an event. As a Hyatt Diamond member, there were a few shortcomings. First and foremost, Hyatt guarantees the "best rate" if you book on its website but, clearly, this is not the case as many of the reviews here indicate a much cheaper rate on Priceline or the like. That is deceptive in my opinion. Your best customers should be offered your best prices (especially if you advertise that they are). Regency Club upgrade, decent, well stocked Club Room with Internet access and computers. No Diamond gift or manager welcome note. $25 is what we were charged for valet and, give half a dozen in and outs, I don't consider this outrageous. Good choice of restaurants in the hotel and within a 100 meter walk. Overall a great deal for those paying the Priceline rates, and a solid Hyatt property that should focus on its best customers a little more. Exactly what I would expect from a Hyatt Regency with this one exception.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room but far from the beach and nightlife”
Reviews.Author: annagrace
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and requested "coastal San Diego". I got this relatively new Hyatt east of Interstate 5 off La Jolla Village Drive in a commercial areaf r $92 per night. The parking was $20 per night but with a little effort we found street parking on the street above the hotel. The rooms were typical for Hyatt, lovely linens and very clean and spacious. The toiletries were spa like and the beds were extremely comfortable. The room was very quiet which was a relief after the experience we had in Las Vegas (see my review of the Luxor Hotel!). I was disappointed with the location as we had to drive to the lovely village of La Jolla but the hotel and its amenities were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, so ignore the Yelp ratings”
Reviews.Author: Gammydodger
Reviews.Content: Booked via Priceline, 3 nights at around $84 per night. Had disappointing reviews on Yelp! which concerned me, however, when I arrived, the hotel was very well located - right off the freeway, and very easy to access - close to various amenities and not too far outside of San Diego (perfect for me traveling to Carlsbad, but wanting to go out in San Diego). The room was clean, spacious and comfortable, great pool and spa, plenty of good restaurants right outside the door. Was a little isolating, it's a big hotel and there aren't that many staff (or didn't seem to be - I think that I said under 20 words to any of the staff at the hotel in 3 days. Parking was pricey, considering there is so much off street parking for free around there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service by the staff”
Reviews.Author: littlelugnut
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent rate from Hotwire.com and stayed here for two nights. The staff was outstanding, and extremely professional and courteous in all aspects. My room was very well furnished and impeccably clean. The bedding was outstanding, and very comfortable. There was a 36" Sony flat screen, which was very nice. The bathroom amenities were also excellent. Upon check-in I received an offer from the adjacent "Sporting Club" for a 25 minute massage and 25 minute facial for $100. I booked an appointment for both, and Todd and Rebecca, respectively, were OUTSTANDING. The fee for the spa facility (normally $13 I believe) was waived if you booked services. Not sure if the fee waiver applied to the gym section as well, as I didn't have time to use it. Only downside was that the whirlpool was out of order. The only thing I didn't care for was the $20/day parking fee, but such is life in the San Diego area. The garage was very well lit and I felt my car was very secure there. Although I didn't order from the menu, the selection of food from the bar in Michael's Lounge was very large, and available every evening until midnight, for the late night snackers that don't want to order room service. Room service charged a 22% service charge (which included a gratuity), in addition to a $4.00 delivery charge when I ordered on my last evening there. All around, a wonderful, relaxing stay. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: we are 2 adults and 1 teenager so we needed 2 double beds and 1 rollaway...without problems, they accomodated us with such a room and even upgraded us to the regency club level where breakfast and evening hors d'oeuves were all complimentary. the food was excellent..for breakfast, there was plenty of lox, bagels, cream cheese, high quality danishes (not the type from costco), fresh fruit, yogurt, starbucks coffee, cold cuts, cheeses, and all the types of juices, pop, and milk you like. for evening appies, there was always a hot dish like meatballs, perogies, or egg rolls , or ravioli plus cold cuts, crackers, cheeses, veggies and dip, nuts, fruit. the wine and beer are honor bar but very reasonable...excellent californian wine for only $4 glass...can't beat that. in the hotel's bar, michaels, they even have 2 billiard tables for $1.50/game so my teenage son and I had a great time playing there...no need to buy drinks but the service was there if you ever needed it. kids under age must leave the premise b4 9pm which is fair enough. the outdoor pool and hot tub is large and clean...lots of towels and great pool food service..there was always someone walking around if you need to order something. when we were there during easter, there even was an easter bunny and egg hunt for the little ones and my 14 yr old son even got into the fun by searching for 1 egg and so did my 82 year old mother. the room is fine...very clean and the large plasma tv is very good. like previous reviews, we did not park in the hotel for $18/day instead we parked on the street for 4 days and there was always parking so why not save the $??? the hotel's location is very close to san diego downtown, about 10min drive, and very close to del mar and carlsbad. it's in a wonderful location and there's just so much to do just in la jolla. right behind the hotel, 10min brisk walk, is whole foods and trader joes so that was convenient. i would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and i know i will return and stay here again but try to book into the regency club level room...

Reviews.Title: “We plan to go back”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We got the Hyatt Regency La Jolla for $106 per night on Hotwire and were very pleased with it. All the staff were very nice and helpful. Mindful of Hyatt's exorbitant parking rates, we parked on the street the whole time and thought it was fine. You do park on a busy road so you have to be careful exiting your car, but the area itself seemed safe. My husband used the gym, which is not a part of the hotel, but you can get a day pass for $13 per day. He said the gym was even better than the one he usually goes to at home and is far better than the typical hotel gym. We had drinks at Michael's two nights and thought that the drinks were not overpriced, and it had a nice atmosphere and friendly bartender. It is true that there is not a lot going on within walking distance of the hotel, although there were a few nice-looking non-hotel restaurants, but you really need a car in San Diego anyway, and nothing is that far away. We go to San Diego about twice a year and definitely plan to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but expensive parking and Internet”
Reviews.Author: clfurman
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was fine, except - I felt the parking was outrageously expensive, and I felt cheated by the high cost of Internet service. I tried the Japanese restaurant on the property. I was not impressed. There are plenty of better restaurants in San Diego if you want good sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and diming”
Reviews.Author: snorklefamily
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice. Parking is extremely expensive. Street parking is available but didn't feel very safe. I was very disappointed at the charges for Internet use. The location stinks unless you want to be near highways. The beach and the charming parts of La Jolla are a drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt!!”
Reviews.Author: bravens
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! Even my 2 picky teenagers loved it! The property was conveniently located, the service was great, breakfast was decent, spotless large room, comfy bed, nice bar, and really quick elevators! The bellhop was wonderful and gave us directions and suggestions on places to go and the closest shopping, coffee, etc. The parking was expensive but I had read on Trip Advisor about street parking which we did during our entire visit. A little inconvenient but saved alot of money. Only really complaint was that they do not offer free wireless! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Common criminals”
Reviews.Author: brianmdr9
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to over 40 countries and stayed in hundreds of hotels and I have never had an experience as bad as I had with the Hyatt. First, the rooms themselves are really no better than a motel room. But that was not the problem. My wife and I stayed in a non-smoking room, as neither of us smoke....and my wife is pregnant to boot. Upon receiving my bill when we returned home the hotel billed us $250.00 for a smoking fee. Outraged, I called the Hotel and they said they found ash on our floor....meaning we smoked. We had lit candles and told them the same. Not only did they not reverse the charges they threatened to charge us $500.00 for a cleaning fee. The reason they gave was so disgusting I can't even post it. We are considering legal action. If your going to stay here, bring your lawyer. And your accountant. These folks are just flat out crooks.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable bed, loud room, expensive parking, but overall modern space”
Reviews.Author: MeetingPlannerSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a marriage conference so we got a great rate of $130 per night. We stayed on the 6th floor in a standard room. When we entered the room, it had a funky smell, but rooms cleanliness was pretty good. There was some stains on the bathrooms walls that looked like they would wash off. The window opened, this helped the smell. The tv was small and old school, not flat screen. Modern rooms other than that and nice meeting space. The bed was hard and not comfortable at all. Outside noise could be heard easily. Forgot our sound machine and the noisiness made it hard to sleep. No Gift shop currently. Not a bad experience, but wouldn't stay there again for personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in early November (election night). Arrived early evening after flying into LAX and driving down and then had an early start (we were running a breakfast seminar @ the hotel) so didn't really use any of the hotel facilities other than those mentioned here. The good thing is the hotel is real easy to locate being just off the freeway. The hotel is in a mini complex which has a couple of restaurants, an office block and the hotel itself. The hotel is fine, the rooms comfortable and everything was smooth. The internet was $9.95 per day and the ability to sign-up with a roaming account was not available. Self park car parking was $18 for the night. For what its worth, the breakfast seminar ran smoothly and the hotel did a good job in that respect. Evening meal with a colleague in the hotel's bar which, as all these places, was over priced but adequate. I paid ~$185 per night. If you have a function at the hotel and its sensible to stay there then the hotel is a good example of its class. If you are planning to base yourself slightly out of San Diego for a few days there is much better value to be had in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Caution - they bump people with confirmed reservations”
Reviews.Author: Londoner80
Reviews.Content: A colleague from work had a confirmed reservation (with credit card), but he arrived in the evening to be told that the Hyatt had no room for him. Under protest, he was relocated to another hotel several miles away. I'd checked in earlier for 2 nights but was repeatedly disturbed my first morning by various members of staff asking if I was in fact staying both nights - and they seemed so desperate to have my room the second night that they never made it up. If this hotel honours your booking, be aware that they will 'nickel and dime' you with high charges for parking, the mini-bar, bottled water, Internet access, the health club, mandatory service fees on room service (a tip is requested on top of that), etc. Otherwise, the hotel itself is very comfortable, the restaurants are good, and the attached health club is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue...”
Reviews.Author: TraceeT
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel and was very pleased with both staff and the accomodations. The decor was modern/slightly Asian, and very soothing and peaceful. Extremely clean rooms and public areas. Excellent friendly and helpful staff. Slightly weird suburban-like location, but I'm not a native of California...so what do I know. I did get street-side parking all 4 days without too much trouble, which I understand is a huge plus in San Diego. Plently of shopping close-by. Overall a great hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all regards...”
Reviews.Author: gbonics
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet: We Pricelined for San Diego Coastal and rec'd a room here. I wanted a bit closer to the water but have wanted to stay here and try since we live about 12 minutes away. Facilities were clean and very nice, but the service was EXCELLENT. I mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary that weekend while talking to registration and lo and behold, a few hours later a waiter showed up at our door w/ a tray full of chocolate-dipped strawberries, blackberries (in a little pyramid) and raspberries and a nice bottle of cab. Wow. Very impressed. Service needs to be recognized more and more these days and the Hyatt Regency shined in this regard. But I will say, park on the street...parking fees are outrageous...

Reviews.Title: “worst vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: gingerdupont
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business/vacation in San Diego. Hyatt was the worst 4 star hotel I have ever stayed at. Stayed 9/1 thru9/7, 3 days didn't get coffee to make in the "one" cup coffee machine and one day didn't get any coffee cup(paper). I have stayed in a 1 star hotel and had a full pot coffee maker. Vanity in bathroom was so small nowhere to put toiletries. Lights and mirrors very poor especially to apply makeup. Hotel in the middle of nowhere and miles to go the the town of LaJolla or the beach. Parking was extremely expensive. Breakfast also buffet(small) 19.00. not worth it. No other close family or casual resturants. Gift shop in hotel was as big as a broom closet. No soda machines anywhere on the premises. We would never stay here again or at any other Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: sleepladypalmdesert
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this facility for a conference. My husband decided to come along at the last minute and wanted to bring his boat, which is trailored behind our massive truck. I called the hotel the day before asking if parking would allow for this. The woman I spoke with said, just come, we will figure it out. Well when we arrived they had a space all set aside for our boat. We had the staff valet park our truck and felt like everything was perfectly safe. On the day that my husband went fishing, they helped him get out....when he arrived with 5, 30 pound Ahi Tuna, they helped us keep them iced until we could leave. They were great. The facility was wonderful. I can't believe how friendly and accomodating the staff was to us. They treated us like VIPs...even with crappy truck and smelly fishing boat in tow. The room was perfectly clean, beds luxiourous. The facilities for the conference were perfect. We used the pool one day, it was wonderful. Had drinks in the bar....ate at the Sushi bar across the way. Everything was perfect and we will most definetely stay here again...and bring the decent car next time...that is unless my husband feels the need to go fishing again. We were staying at a conference rate...so, the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Parking Ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: broadcast9
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located- right off highway. About 20 minutes to downtown with no traffic. Close to the beautiful La Jolla Cove- which is worth seeing. Rooms are large- very clean. Amenities are as advertised- the pool is nice. Did not eat at the hotel- 4 nice restaraunts right across the street. Parking is a rip off- there is free on street parking north and south of the hotel where most employees park.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right off the freeway, so quick access to the San Diego area. Nice hotel, clean, updated. The room was spacious. The pool area is wonderful, just wish that it was open later than 10PM. The only complaints were that the walls are thin and you can hear everything going on in the rooms around you. We were woken up early both mornings with children yelling and slamming doors. It sounded as if they were in our room. We could also hear people's conversations speaking at normal tone. One other minor problem was that the bathtub stopper did not work. But overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Aventine La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: TAMARASW
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful stay at this Hyatt! We used Hyatt Passport rewards (my husband's business travel perks) to book a standard room with a king-sized bed. But when we arrived, my husband told the staff it was our anniversary and asked for any complimentary upgrades that might be available. We were assigned to a beautiful suite, maybe 1200 sq. ft. on the 16th floor, with club privileges. We also received a complimentary evening snack delivered to our room by roomservice and turndown service, as well. Our room was immaculate, the bed very comfortable, and the staff very friendly. Now, granted, we would not have had this room if we were paying for it! But it just goes to show it's worth asking for upgrades. We also spent some time at the pool, which was beautiful and clean, and the pool staff very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull Hotel But I Left Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jimboc
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this this is a nice-lookng hotel. Good-looking rooms, restaurants and lobbies. But overall, I am a value-oriented traveller and my stay at the Hyatt La Jolla left me disappointed. I stayed in a standard room booked through a corporate training facility that my employer uses. Rate was $225 a night for 5 nights. The problem was the fact the the room was apparently not cleaned before my arrival. The bathroom floor had stains and hair in the bathtub that wasn't cleaned until my 3rd night there. The garbage cans were also full when I got there. Not acceptable. I also got the tired of being overcharged for nearly everything. I had a can of soda from the minibar my first night there. That cost me $5. The room service pizza that I ordered set me back $26. Whenever I visited the gym, I was charged $20 per visit. Internet service was $10 or $12 per night, and if I visited the business center that would have cost me $10. Finally, I tried to get credit for my stay on my new Hyatt Gold Passport card, but was told that my rate did not merit any points. Get the picture? Still, there were positives. The breakfast and lunch buffets were excellent. The service was generally good. And of course, the views from the room were neat. Unfortunately, my sense of being nickel and dimed to death, along with the fact that my room really wasn't being cleaned until midway in my stay left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely La Jolla Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: life_is_my_vacation
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt La Jolla is a wonderful option for San Diego business and leisure visitors alike. The service is top-notch, as is usually in Hyatt hotels - the staff is helpful, courteous, and friendly. The rooms are nice, with comfortably beds, but housekeeping only changes the sheets every three days and doesn't bother to re-tuck the bottom sheets, so on days two and three, they're sliding and bunched and you're forced to make your own bed. The bathrooms are nothing special, but the shower is good. Valet and self-parking are really expensive, but we always found free street parking. The pool is really nice, with lanes for lap swimming, and there's also a good jacuzzi. There are some nice shops and restaurants nearby, including a Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Ralph's (with delicious Golden Spoon frozen yogurt inside), Starbucks. Einsteins, etc. With a location right off the freeway but with no noise, this is a great choice for inland La Jolla and visiting San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Regency Club lounge, access to the Sporting Club, close to Torrey Pines”
Reviews.Author: lilzeppelin
Reviews.Content: Located next to Hwy 5, the hotel is convenient to access La Jolla, Torrey Pines Reserve, beaches and is close to the Whole Foods, Peets Coffee, etc. Guests also have access to the Sporting Club for about 10$ a visit (the prices on Hyatt concierge website are outdated) which is an independent high-end gym as well as free pool. Since we had access to the 16th floor club lounge, we found that to be one of the best features of our stay, Recently re-modelled the lounge offered an impressive aray of food, snacks, and their coffee was excellent. The staff are very personable and helpful. The lounge also has two computers with huge monitors, if you do not have T-mobile hotspot access on your laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel...Good alternative to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: DimaVet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 night in two rooms in the end of April Good alternative to San Diego Downtown hotels - 10 minutes to historic La Jolla and 15 minutes to Gaslamp District Check-in was in seconds. We had no problem to get two non-smoking rooms next to each other. Rooms were nice and clean, bed - comfortable. Excatly what you expect it from Haytt. Reception and conciergewere very friendly and co-operative. One big NO - valet service - buch of the irresponsible and somewhat rude teens without proper management and supervision. Bar is not that good - so would strictly recommend to go out either to La Jolla or San Diego downtowns Overall - solid and fairly priced hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: spyglassweb
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful about our stay. The rooms and grounds are kept in immaculate condition and look even better than the pictures. I stayed with my 12 year old for spring break. The service is outstanding, and very friendly. No snooty attitudes here! In fact, by the end of the stay many of the staff knew us by name. I hurt my back kayaking, and asked to help locate a chiropractor near by. The front desk, not only helped me find one, but also called them, booked my appointment and printed out a map for me. Very impressive! The pool area is fabulous, and very relaxing, with many comfortable areas to sit. It was only in the low to mid 60's, however with the heated pool it was very comfortable to swim...and I tend to be very sensitive to cold. The whirlpool is kept clean and very warm. The sound from fountain behind is very nice and totally masks the fact that there is a freeway behind. You wouldn't know it! There are a lot of white males doing laps, but also some families with kids as well. If you wish to avoid the parking fee, there is parking near by. We stayed 4 nights and, at the most, had to park two blocks away, it is a nice walk so I didn't mind. There is a 15 minute grace period in front of the hotel, which we used a few times for loading, etc. The hot breakfast buffet was wonderful. It is $20 for adults and $10 for kids, and includes juice. It was well worth it. Also there is a coffee kiosk in the lobby, with good Starbucks coffee ($3.50), and free refills. The area is very convenient, right off of highway I-5. It is centrally located between San Diego (Sea World, zoo) and Escondito (Wild animal park). You are 8 minutes from the beach, which has ocean kayaking trips. La Jolla is gorgeous and everywhere you look and drive the view is more breathtaking than the next. There are stores nearby, but not walking distance. There is a huge Whole Foods very close. It was great to grab a healthy, reasonably priced, meal from the large hot bar, salad bar, pizza oven etc. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Alaskabound2
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a 2 day conference in October of last year. The room I stayed in was clean and nicely appointed. It took me a while to find a parking spot on the street but did find it both nights I was there. It's kind of isolated from restaurants (other than the ones in the same compound as Hyatt). It was too cold to use the pool, albeit a couple of people did so. It looked nice and clean. At the check in desk, a female concierge was pleasant and helpful. Would stay there again is I have any business again in La Jolla. It's an expensive place, but I guess even Motel 6 would be expesince in that area :)

Reviews.Title: “Best area of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: EMonkeys
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean and nice looking. Got a AAA discount so it wasn't too expensive. Cleanest & most upscale part of San Diego...great Beach near by and really good restaurants - Even one of the ones on property was suprisingly very good. Definitely recomend it and will go again next time I go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times in La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: OC_BH
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews on this site of the 4-Star hotels in the area prompted me to use Hotwire to book the room at (what I felt) was a great rate for what we received. Opted for the valet parking ($24) since we were only there for one night, but probably would have resorted to the street parking (free) if it was more than that. Was able to check in at a kiosk and not wait in line (GREAT!), and got straight to the room in 5 mins from walking in the front door. Rooms are modern, clean, great furniture and amenities. View looked to the east, but the dark curtains blocked all sun coming in the next morning. Visited the hotel bar, which was clean and friendly with flat-screen tv's and two pool tables, which was cool to have (but didnt play). Also had couches and chairs for lounging in. Bartended was friendly and attentive. Outside of valet area are 4 restaurants ranging from fondue, to sea food, steak, mexican, and asian-fusion. Lots of nearby restaurants to hit within a few blocks. pool area was great, but weather was cold, so we didnt visit. But area had cabanas with padded lounges for use (didnt see anything about having to rent them), and plenty of towels to go around. Wish I could have checked out the gym/spa, but wasnt there to work out, just to relax, and the extra $10 charge didnt help. Concierge and Bell desks were very respectful, always calling me by my last name and always having my car ready when I called down for it. In all, a very nice place to stay, would recommend and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Davidsad
Reviews.Content: I syated at the La Jolla Hyatt for four nights as part of a conference and found it to s superior hotel. Check in was swift and the bell staff very courteous in showing me my room. Desk staff and concierge were friendly and helpful, especially with dinner reservations in downtown La Jolla. My room was on the 14th floor, with sweeping views. It was quiet and well appointed, and the bed provided me with a sound sleep. Conference accomodations were excellent and the meeting stafff catered to all of our needs. The valet parking was polite and quick, in contrast to what some others have said. My one qualm is the location: it is totally car-centered, and far from any beach if you try to walk or bike.

Reviews.Title: “quality”
Reviews.Author: pintsize79
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel in a gorgeous part of san diego, the rooms and the food were excellent. we also loved the pool scene. however more expensive for parking than the others we had stayed at in california

Reviews.Title: “Nice Typical Hyatt Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travell_Diva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from La Jolla spening Christmas week at this hotel. The hotel was not busy at all this particular week. Also, this time of the year the sun does not directly shine on the the pool itself because of the building in front of it. It does, however shine on the chaise lounges surrounding the pool. This property is a nice hotel and we got what we expected from this chain. Actually, given our rate of $119 which inluded a hot breakfast buffet, we had no complaints. We found this AAA "bed and breakfast" promotion through the Hyatt website. The buffet alone runs $20 p/p. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is a fee for both valet and self parking. We never had a probelm finding free street parking surrounding the hotel. If you are a tennis player, I noticed a sign for the La Jolla Village tennis club a couple blocks east from the hotel. The is also the La Jolla tennis club in town near the ocean. I didn't play at either but I did notice them in those locations. We stopped for drinks and clam chowder at the Crab Catcher in town. They had great happy hour specials from 4-7, M-F, on drinks and several half-off menu items such as yummy fish tacos, calamari, sandwiches, etc. They are on the ocean with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency La Jolla, terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: bmvend
Reviews.Content: We arrived the day after Christmas for a two night stay. We had several problems. When we first pulled in the doorman and valets were all standing around as it was very slow period.
